caption: Solid place in Hyde Park, and definitely needed. While I don't find the food here particularly amazing, I've always enjoyed the atmosphere. It's a great place to bring some friends, share some pizza/fries/beer, and stay for Pub Trivia on Tuesdays. The pizzas are quite large and loaded, so for two people, a 12" is enough.
For the the beer lovers.
Great beer
Good food, good prices.  A family place with lots of TV's for adults of every sport.
Try the chicken sandwich!
The food is good, but the past couple times I've gone the service has been terrible.

Jolly Pumpkin’s sour ales were... um, not good. Luckily they served real beer from another brewery and those were ok. We got two pizzas and those were decent, but the service behind the bar was pretty terrible. The bartender didn’t smile once and pretty much did the minimum. That said, the servers and greeters seemed very nice. Hopefully we just caught the bartender in a bad mood, because if I saw that she were working I’d just go somewhere else.

service is awful! i’m currently watching the owner i believe standing over plates of food but not serving them. lazy much? truffle fries are ok but 8 bucks. kind of ridiculous. wish there were more food options on the menu. drinks are fine, but nothing special.

I love breweries and I love Jolly Pumpkin beers so I knew I had to visit. I didn't know that Jolly Pumpkin also distills a variety of spirits, as well as craft beers. The environment was relaxed but a little loud due to high ceilings. Our server was great, too and quite knowledgeable. As for the food, it was delicious. We were also surprised to find out that while not advertised, they have gluten free bun and pizza crust options (a rarity!). I'll definitely return to try more of their beers and amazing curried chips.
Really enjoyed the food and beer. The flights are a good price too. And it's a very comfortable and welcoming atmosphere. Definitely will be back!
Great pizza and quick service
Terrible service. Food was terrible, too.
Great 🍻 and food. If you're into sour beers this is your place!
The truffle fries are to die for

I have tried on numerous occasions to request a specific sandwich.  The order is taken and it is returned incorrect. In person it's a hassle to send it back and  wait for the correction. When it is ordered to go it is even more disappointing.  The standard chicken sandwich comes with a spicy spread  I'm not a spicy person so I always ordered it without any toppings, including the sauce.  I love,love, love the sandwich this  way. But 50%-60% of the time I request what I want and I'm given the standard. Please try to get it right. Usually dont wrote reviews but I had a long day at work and was looking forward to the sandwich😔

Great place as they have a variety of beers. It’s called a brewery but their beer is sourced from a different brewery.  Unfortunately as seen in other reviews our server was not very polite but apart from that the place is good and easy to get parking.
One of my favorite places to go in hyde park!
Nacho too soggy. I tried artisan beers but they were all too sour. I liked the beer on the bottom of the menu tho. Staff were very friendly

Slow and unprofessional service. My wife and I ordered a burger to split. The server gave us a choice of sides without mentioning that french fries cost an additional $2. Yes, apparently the menu mentions the additional cost, but the server should have pointed this out when she offered up the choice of sides. We ordered the fries and were charged $4 (apparently because two of us were splitting a burger, so suddenly one order of fries cost $4). The server should have let us know we were going to be charged extra for an unremarkable burger that was already overpriced to begin with. We are not coming back, and I am leaving you a one-star review. I hope the $4 was worth it.
Great food, beers.
My daughter didn't enjoy the sweet tea. Understand up north they don't have sweet tea only unsweet. 😒
Get the cauliflower crisps!
I will definitely visit this place again.
Great location and the beer is great. $8-10 for a beer and about $10-16 for a meal. Pretty standard for Chicago

This brewpub is a nice addition to the neighborhood. Wide selection of beers. Their house-brewed beers are all sour but they carry another brewery which is more traditional. That makes for a diverse beer flight potential. Food is pretty good. Seating is long tables with some booths and a nice bar, too. Young crowd and a few families are usually populating the place when I go. Employees have always been nice, and service has been okay. Not a place to get excited about, but a solid choice for a night out of beer and food.
Great beer good atmosphere.
Food was good
Good pizza
We came for the vegan pizza and we really liked it. It was savory and the staff was very friendly. The ambiance is alive and would definitely come back!

Food and drinks were excellent. Mushroom truffle pizza was outstanding. Service was the worst. The server was absent or inattentive. When I couldn't find her, I asked someone else for red pepper. He came back and slammed it on the table.

We are from out of town.  We visited twice because of the convenience to our hotel.  Food and beer were great service was terrible.  When I say terrible I mean the worst I have ever received at a restaurant.  Last night we asked for our check 3 times.  We even asked the manager for our check.   After 45 minutes we stood to leave they finally presented us with our check.  After another 10 or 15 minutes we were finally able to leave.  Too bad for the service because we did enjoy the food and beer.

Visited on 11/20 and had a terrible experience. It was incredibly hard to enjoy the good food and beer with the extremely poor service. Recommend the carnivore pizza  by the way that being said there is clearly something going on with the staff when every interaction comes with some form of frustration and anger. The crazy thing the place was empty at the time. There are far too many other foodbar options to have to put with poor customer service.

Pizza was ok, but the service (waitress) was terrible, not sure why, place was basically empty. Looks like I’m not alone judging by the reviews. Manager has some work to do. Won’t be going back. Experienced on 11/20, ~4pm.

The worst possible service anyone could ever give.  Beer is great and if you go here sit at the bar.  Waitress' are terrible and will directly shake you down if you did not leave at least a 20% tip.  Not sure if you can ever leave a negative tip, but this is the first place I have ever seen in my entire 44 years that this would be justifiable.  Absolutely terrible.  Place was empty yesterday 11/20 and now I know why.  Good Luck Jolly Pumpkin, hope you can get better waitstaff because the food and beer are great!
The food is very good. Not much of a beer drinker ans they dont have many other options for drinks. The service is also pretty slow no matter how busy they are.
Great place
It was ok......I would not go back because parking and it was just ok
Ok

I'm not sure what the justification for the spotty reviews at Jolly Pumpkin are.  They have SICK sour beers, the staff is super nice, and the pizza is on point - it's a fluffier crust with a sweeter style of marinara / pizza sauce.  Their trivia night on Tuesdays is a lot of fun too.  Sweet tunes.  Free beers if you get certain questions right.  And, the host is a riot.  Will definitely be back. :)

I frequent this location and sit at the bar.  Yesterday, 10/23, I was disappointed in the service from #10 (no name on receipt).  I was never asked if I wanted a food entree, and was never given any utensils or napkins  when I received my nachos.  I watched others go the bar to place orders with number 10.  After she took an order, she would not say thank you or even say okay but would simply walk to the register to key in the order.  during my whole time there number 10 never even smiled  and only offered a refill of my water when my meal and drink was finished and I was leaving.   I can say it was busy but number 10 had help at the bar area.  There are plenty of locations in Hyde Park with better service. it will be a long time before I visit this location again.

(Translated by Google) The pizza with goat cheese and truffles is to die for, and their "sour beers" are worth the detour!  (Original) La pizza au chèvre et truffes est à tomber, et leurs "sour beers" valent le détour !
Good food, good beer, a casual sports bar for groups.
Excellent menu, interesting brews, fresh food, friendly informative servers.
(Translated by Google) Badly advised by the beer I've had.  (Original) Mal asesorado por la cerveza que me he tomado.
Wait staff seems more intrested in socializing amongst themselves that waiting on people.
Nice beer selection. Feels more like a restaurant than a bar but still a nice place
I was estimen my wallet
Good beer, good food, good atmosphere. Their pizzas are killer too-- a must try!

Two stars for the beer which is the same and always good, but the service has gone very far downhill in the last year. Not sure why they changed from a counter-order to “table service” establishment. It was much faster to wait in their old line than to wait for the servers to notice you the way it’s currently set up. Most of the time, there are no servers on the floor at all, and when there are, they ignore you. We got our own ketchup, etc. We waited so long for our check and then for our card to be picked up that we just took the card to the counter to pay. When we did, a server goes, “Can I help you, bro?” When my boyfriend explained that he wanted to pay, the server said “ok” and walked away.  On a less important note, it doesn’t make sense to take away all the menus after you order food, because it’s a brew pub — it isn’t as if anyone is coming there for the food. I ordered the JP burger medium-rare and got it on an untoasted bun and done medium-well. Maybe I had annoyed the server by asking for it medium-rare twice and she decided to take revenge. We used to come here often when it was counter service, but now sadly can’t justify coming anymore.

Drinks are fine if you're into craft beer but the food is a major disappointment. Ordered the collard melt which I thought was going to be a grilled cheese on sourdough with greens in it. What I got was an expensive and sad looking open face sandwich. It was a single piece of flabby, untoasted bread smothered in cheese sauce with bits of collard greens in it. Tasty enough but very unappealing to look at. Also it was served on parchment paper for some reason so when I used a knife and fork to eat it the parchment would tear and get stuck to the sandwich. I was pulling bits of paper out of my mouth on every bite. It was supposed to come with curry chips but I received a pile of plain potato chips that I'm pretty sure came out of a bag. It's laughable that it cost me 12 bucks. Life is too short to go back here again.
Love the industrial interior. Service was a little slow and it was too cold inside to really enjoy the meal. Employees were super nice tho, and food was decent.

Drinks are great. But FOOD omg... Truffle fries. Huge thin crust personal pizzas. Their salads are also huge!!! They do fun events and have lots of TV's too for sports etc. Great place to hang with my grad school friends.

The pizza is really just OK for its price. It tastes like expensive papa John's with extremely chewy and sweet pizza dough. Some pizza like the south Pacific is too creative to be acceptable. The sauce and the pizza has a very strong taste of sugar. I would not recommend this place if you crave for pizza.
Just ok
Good food and drinks!
Came here for late night drinks and food. The kitchen closes an hour before they do. 🙁 Not a great first time experience.
Good beer and wings
Love this place I come often!! The drink " the looking glass" is phenomenal!!
Wonderful assortment of beers and ales. The food is not bad.
Nothing spectacular, but good food and decent beer selection. Typical sports bar feel.
Cooperation Draft Beer. 9.7% ABV. Enough said :)

There are much better places to eat in Hyde Park. Jolly Pumpkin is over priced and flavorless. The wings are okay but the pizza is extremely flavorless. Their soda selection is dismal. If you just want beer then it’s okay. If you’d like dinner with your beer then this isn’t the place for you.  Update: we visited Jolly Pumpkin with the new menu. It was better, however, the nachos were poorly constructed. The cooked too long so all the toppings were stuck to a few top chips all the chips in the middle and bottom were just over cooked tortillas. The cauliflower was great and the kids menu was good as well.
Hmmm hmmm very Good!!!
Great service. Delicious food. Interesting decor. Parking is Chicago standard, but definitely worth it.
Delicious vegan friendly dishes!

I absolutely love the food and drinks at Jolly Pumpkin. We were so excited to have a brewery in Hyde Park. However, the service is some of the worst that I have ever experienced. The management and wait staff are clearly not trained for table service. I understand that there is to be a learning curve while switching from counter to full service, but the service has been going downhill steadily. I have had the occasional good waiter/waitress, but the horrible experiences outweigh the good ones.  I recently had a large group event (20 people) there. We called ahead and were even required to sign a contract. However, when we arrived just a few minutes early (if you aren't early, you are late), the hostess and manager were unsure where to sit us and had to split us up.  As people trickled into the event, not a single waiter/waitress approached our table until almost 45 minutes after our reservation. We had to find the manager and ask for a waiter. Then it took another 45 minutes for our drinks to arrive. We made sure to order our entrees when our waiter dropped off our drinks. We flagged our waiter down to put in another order for drinks, flagged him down 30 minutes later to check on those drinks, and then received those drinks another 15 minutes later.  We received the bill from the second table of our group, and then we had to ask that waitress to hunt our waiter down to get our check. We could have easily left without paying, but we would have felt horrible regardless of the poor service.  In summary, the food is great, but the service should either return to counter service or be completely revamped. The horrendous service also appears to stem from the poor management.

the service here is absolutely terrible. We went here with a large party, for which we had called ahead four days in advance so that they knew we would be coming and could accommodate us. As it was a rather large party, we signed a contract with them for guaranteed gratuity, etc well in advance. Me and one of the other guest arrived 10 min early, so we spoke with the hostess and she seemed confused for our large party. Her and the manager then had to figure out how to even seat us because they had not already set aside the tables, which we thought would be done based on our communication with them days earlier.  We are finally seated as more of our party shows up. No server comes over to greet us, take a drink order, nothing. We have now been sitting there for 20 minutes. I had to flag down a waiter who when I asked if we could place a drink order as we had been waiting and no one had come over yet, responded just "uh sure" and walked away. 10 more minutes passed and another member of our party had to flag down the manager who then said he had to tell the waiters it was okay to serve us. I have never heard of a scenario where a manager has to give a server an "okay" to serve a party that made a reservation?! 10 more minutes later and we can finally place a drink and appetizer order.  40 minutes after sitting down we finally had water pitchers brought to our table.  Appetizers come out timely but it is about 30-40 minutes after placing our drink order (over an hour after we had been seated!) that most of our table received their drinks. There was a mix up with my drink apparently, because I did not receive it. but no server communicated this with me.  10 minutes later I flag down the hostess as she is the only one walking any where near our table and ask if she can check on my drink as i ordered it AN HOUR AGO. She says sure, she'll talk to someone. She then proceeds to just continue back to the hostess stand and I never once see her talk to a waiter or bartender about getting my drink sorted.  An hour and 15 minutes after we were seated, we can finally flag down our waiter to place a food order. I ask him about my drink. He tells me there was a mix up and the bartender is working on it. It is another 15 minutes before I even get my drink. At this point we had been there an hour and a half.  After my drink, I left frustrated while the rest of my party ate dinner (which did not come out before two hours after we were seated).  This was the most disappointing and terrible service I have ever had in my life. This place has great food and drinks, but the service and treatment of customers here makes me not want to give them my business.
Nice and cozy place with great atmosphere and cuisine
There was a great atmosphere and very creatively designed beer labels, this restaurant clearly has a lot of character.

They got rid of the tuna melt! Why? The tuna melt was so good and was the only item I ordered.  I got the white fish and crab sandwich and it was pretty good too,  I will get it again but I wish the tuna melt would come back.
The nachos are the best thing to eat.
Great place, love their beers. The Cooperation is amazing. The bartenders are excellent, and the food is great.

The drink selection is wonderful. Now that they are full service you can fully enjoy the atmosphere. They have amazing service also. The food leaves a bit to be desired and is a bit overpriced for what you get.
Half empty venue Friday night, were told to wait for seating because "waiter is too busy". Left after 15 minutes, very unpleasant experience. Does management know about this practice?

Waited too long to be seated. Were told to wait 5 minutes. Ok, no problem. Waited 10 minutes, asked when the table was going to be ready. There were available tables outside but the hostess said the waitress was too busy, and suggested that we wait another 4 minutes or so. Ridiculous.
Food and beer are actually good, but the moral of the employees is very low.  The place was very quiet and I could feel the tension between the staff. I just didn't feel comfortable dining there.

It's always great to try local places in towns that you visit. There beer was good even though they were out of a lot (said they were getting their shipment today). They had a good Groupon 2-4 beer flights and a growler filled with beer of choice for $30. Nice atmosphere open rustic feel with a lot of tables, big bar and patio seating. The food menu looked good but we just came for the beer, Dusk & Perk were some of our favorites. They have a lot of sours and even though we aren't huge sour fans we still tried some.
Great atmospher, friendly staff. I had the truffle fries but couldn't taste the truffle oil, everything else was wonderful!
Great choices here, there's something for everyone! Very creative dishes. Vegans won't feel left out.

Great service and cute interior! The variety of beers was exceptional. Our table had pizza (yum!) and burgers (yum!). The Hawaiian pizza was to die for 🍍! Will definitely return for another meal to the Jolly Pumpkin.

The beers weren't that great, and the service was pretty terrible. Our server seemed like he could not be bothered with our existence though the station he was working from was right in front of our seats at the bar.
Nice place to spend a late Sunday afternoon. 👍🏾
Nachos are amazing! Food comes out hella fast and hella good

Great interior and outdoor patio spaces. I did not try the beer, the cocktail I had was just OK. Service was great and food looked delicious. Lots of TVs showing a variety of sporting events including Le Tour de France when I was there. Would recommend as a date night spot or a family friendly meal.

I can’t review too much of this place because I only got as far as the host’s podium. As soon as I opened the door, someone wearing a “security” uniform barked at me “Can I help you?” while putting up an arm to block my entrance. Not being accustomed to seeing or being stopped by security in restaurants, I thought maybe there was some emergency taking place and I was being barred and asked for safety reasons. A quick look around showed that this wasn’t the case, so I asked the guy if there was a problem and was I not allowed to come in. Instead of answering my question, he shouted something at the two people standing at the host podium. I couldn’t hear their exchange but the “security” later turned back to me and again shouted at me “are you ordering something?” To which I responded with something close to “what the hell do you think I’m here for?” I then proceeded to the hosts and asked one of them if the “security” was in their employment (or that of the event taking place outside). The host stated that he was their employee. I then explained to the host that because of how he believes people should be greeted when entering a restaurant that they had just lost my business as well as my friends that were to join me. The host gritted his teeth, closed his eyes, and sighed before apologizing through his teeth, so it seemed very insincere. And he made no move to talk to the “security” about his behavior. Regardless of whether or not he meant it, it was far too late anyway as I was no longer interested in spending any of my money there.  The proprietors seriously need to retrain their staff - customer service starts at the door. That and/or change the name from “Jolly”.
I like their craft beer and starters. Try the cauliflower so goood
Nice ambience but It took an hour almost before our  order was served and it's not even a busy  time:-( the salad was a bit dry...
Great pizza and drinks.
Great beer. Also,  I just so happened to be blessed by an exclusive soundtrack of ALL Prince tunes.
A little overpriced. Also the daily special wasn't available and instead of telling me they brought me an entirely be different order?!??
So fantastic. I got the smokey pizza which is the perfect marriage between a Thai peanut pizza and a BBQ chicken pizza. My friend, who hates BBQ loved this spicy, smoky, cheesy pizza.
Martin provided stellar service, couldn't have asked for a better experience. Job well done, Jolly!

It was my favorite place in Hyde Park and used to go all the time, when you could just go, order your stuff and seat wherever you wanted. It was super chill and it was a great place to meet with friends. They changed that unexpectedly, and now you have to be seated and order from a waiter, like a restaurant. I went two more times since the change, and never went back afterwards. Also, last few times it seemed they only had IPAs and Sours; all the beers I wanted were out. I ended up ordering wine (in a brewery). Food is still delicious and the place is nice, but I used to go for the bar and chill vibe, not the restaurant.
This place was average. Good help. Food was okay. They had virtually no beer available. Prices were okay I wouldn't pay that much again. Go once to try is all I can say.

Attractive sports bar decor, friendly waiter and good food, mostly pizza and sandwiches. Located in busy walkable area. No dedicated parking, very scarce street parking. Busy, but no waiting on Wednesday night.

This is a fairly new addition to Hyde Park/Univ of Chicago area.  Lots of specials for students in a bright open spaced woody craft brew pub.  I can't believe it is in a mall.  There are lots of options on the menu from pizza to sandwiches, pasta, salads.  The beer is tasty and fresh. Lots of tables for large or small groups, the service was slow as they have recently switched to a server based system.  Our server, at least, was slow and was pretty nonchalant about it.  When patrons are ordering 2 beers at a time or when they only have 1/2 a beer, it should tell you something.  But, overall it was a 3.5 to 4.0 on the scale given the slow service.
Good service and food. Could go for more on the food selections
Loved the pizza!

(Translated by Google) The draft beer house in Hyde Park. There are traces of attention to interior design, and there are many big TVs that can watch sports games. There are five cocktails and about 20 beers, and they only sell beer made directly from the brewery. Food is pizza and hamburger is main. It's not too loud, but it's alive.  (Original) 하이드파크에 있는 생맥주집. 인테리어 디자인에 신경을 쓴 흔적이 보이며 스포츠경기를 볼 수 있는 큰 티비들도 많다. 다섯개의 칵테일과 20가지 정도의 맥주가 있으며 직접 양조장에서 만든 맥주들만 판다. 음식은 피자랑 햄버거가 메인이다. 너무 시끄럽지는 않지만 생기있는 분위기이다.
👍very delicious pizza, + 🍺👍👍

‘Happy Father’s Day!’ -  said no one. We’re not even sure a server knew or cared (?) that we were sat. The service here was SO terrible we got up and left.  It took 20 minutes in this quiet half-empty restaurant for the 3 of us to be greeted and then led to a table. The hostess was disengaged and unmotivated.  When sat, all the staff was sauntering around like tired turtles; the vibe was pretty bad. There are several TVs but the only one playing sound was overly loud and tuned to a news broadcast in Spanish. A lot of tables looked stagnant, waiting for something; no one smiling. It all felt ‘off’ and nothing we expected from Jolly Pumpkin. Not sure if the B Crew is on staff on Sunday’s but it looked like no one was running the show.  After 5 minutes of waiting at our table we felt uncomfortable, cut our loses and left, which really stinks because we drove far to take my husband here for a special lunch.
This is a great place for a casual lunch or dinner or just a few beers.  They recently changed from order-at-the counter to seating guests and having servers wait on them.
Good pizza, great crab and fish sandwich and good service!

The pizza was delicious and despite the busy atmosphere,  service was pretty good. I wish the server knew to NOT TOUCH THE RIM OF THE CUP because that's nasty AF. Aside from that, and potentially him being high, he was attentive and pleasant.
Great place good pizza. The beers, however are an acquired taste.  If you like sour beers, they have a lot to choose from. I would definitely come back!

My friends and I come here every week for trivia. Atmosphere is great, waiters/waitresses/hostesses are amazing, beer is good, food is good but overpriced. Last night we ordered a thing of truffle fries with all our beers as we always do. They brought out what tasted like normal fries (we think they forgot the truffle oil). No big deal, no one’s fault, there was just a mistake. My friend tells the waiter. The waiter was great about it and said we could keep the other fries, and he’d bring out a new order of the fries with the truffle oil. A few minutes later he comes back and says the manager said if we wanted more we’d have to buy more. The waiter looked nervous, so my friend told him not to worry about it. I overheard and didn’t think this was right, as the manager’s solution was that we (a group of 6-8 customers who come for trivia every week) pay the full price for truffle fries when we received regular French fries. I went up to the bar to talk to the manager hoping she would at least take a few bucks off because on principle that is just not right. The manager was incredibly rude, interrupted me multiple times as I tried to explain her my request, was very sassy and unprofessional, and worst of all SHE CALLED ME HONEY. In the end she agreed to give my friend a free thing of fries, but her attitude towards her customers was completely unreasonable. This bar/restaurant is going completely downhill, starting with hiring a manager with the worst people skills I have ever seen.
Best Rosemary Aioli ever!
Good food. Good beer. Somewhat expensive though

Nice atmosphere, really good food (had the wings and a pizza to share), and the beers were good. The pours are good and they have a long beer list. My only complaint was that there weren't that many different types of brews just a lot of variations of the same brews. So if you are someone who likes fruity brews, there are a TON of options. If you are someone who likes pale ales, there are a lot of options. Someone who likes hoppy brews has a few choices. But if you want something truly "different," experimental, or a coffee brew like I love (which I've seen at a lot of other breweries in the city) there isn't any/much so I'd suggest somewhere else.  On an eco-friendly note, I'd knock off half a star if I could. They gave us plastic straws right away for our waters which I didn't like, but we just didn't touch them. At the end I was happy to see their take out box seemed to be eco-friendly and biodegradable. HOWEVER, it was so flimsy that if you held half of the box it started to bend in half and fold in on itself. It didn't even make it through the Uber home and I had it in an empty reusable bag. Felt like they were only half trying to be eco-friendly and their attempt (the box) was a giant flop....literally.
New favorite place near Chicago. The beer selection is amazing and the food is delicious. My server was so nice and thoughtful when advising on choices of beverage!
Good beer selection and lots of pizza and burger options. Not life changing or particularly unique fixture in Hyde park but I’m sure the students appreciate having it!
Exceed service by Amanda. Great food, we loved the black bean burger and the fire and smoke pizza. The beer was excellent. Very good experience.

We showed up with 18 people, without a reservation, an hour before the kitchen closed. We were unaware they had transitioned from a fast casual to full service since we had visited the year prior. Management was stellar and made it work. Huge props to the staff from Half Acre Cycling.  Beer: 🔥 Food: 🔥 Staff: 🔥🔥🔥🔥
Great spot. Neat environment. Interesting and unique, and yummy, beer. Good food with vegetarian options. Friendly service.
Great place for good food and drink!
Hyde park's brewpub. They recently changed from counter-serve to table-serve, which has kind of killed the pub vibe. Decent option if you don't want to leave Hyde park.
I love the new model!
Never been there before

The place used to be my favorite one in Hyde Park, Chicago. Unfortunately, the management decided to turn it in a more upscale style restaurant but on the look only. So now, I have to be seated by a host on the same seat I could seat myself for years before those changes took place, the service is very slow to attend, and the old by experience not by age bartenders are not here any more. They hired some very young folk instead , but the new hires can't say much about the beer selections, ingredients, or production process. As a result, my visits to the Jolly dropped from at least once a week to once a quarter of a year.

I have been coming here since they opened. They are responsive to their patrons when a complaint or criticism is made. They have the best sours in Chicago. The trivia on Tuesday is one of the few competetive nerd ones in Chicago. The fish burger is one of my favorite burgers in all of Chicago. Up there with anything from DMK.
Great pizza!!
Sour beer and good 🍕

A wonderful range of beers and food. We had the flyers which enabled us to sample multiple drinks, which were of reasonable size. The food was good and the staff were able to cater for our dietary needs too.
Amazing pizza
Nice beer and snack place for college crowd. Food is decent.

Although their specialty is sour beers, they also have a traditional tap list as well. They usually list a cider on tap. The tap list rotates fairly quickly (and is only of their beer), and they frequently run out of listed taps. Food selection is solid. Nice addition to the neighborhood. Can be loud on trivia nights (Tuesdays), lots of TV's.
The drinks was amazing
Fantastic truffle fties and fried chicken sandwich.

It was my first time there. I can't remember the drink name (flavored mojitos) but it was soooo good. The TRUFFLE fries were AMAZING with the Whitefish & crab burger. I can't wait to go back. The customer service was on point.
Very fancy. Good beer and food.
Fun place! They make their own spirits!
We had a burger, which was really good and pizza which was also very good. Unsweet tea was perfect as well
Best pizza I've ever had  and I've had alot.   Great service  great selection
Good beer. Good food. Fast service. Fun atmosphere.
Enjoyed this place with friends on a stop in to Chicago. Fun good beer, drinks and food. played Halloween bingo, what a fun atmosphere.
great food, great beer, friendly staff

Came to this pizzeria with my father who was visiting from Florida. I'm definitely going to be coming back here with my girlfriend, and we live up on the North Side! The pizza was phenomenal. The beer was even better! We also got a salad and the crispy cauliflower appetizer which was 💯  Highly recommend Jolly Pumpkin to anyone who lives in Chicago! You won't be disappointed!
Most of the beers we ordered were out of stock, and the pizza had candied pineapple on it. Would not go back. However the atmosphere wasn't bad and the waiter was fantastic.
Great beer selection tasty food and amazing service

They don't serve wine. Only beer. I only ordered the chicken sandwich. Typically bc I like to give helpful and honest reviews, I order a lot of food. But I was limited to pizza and burger options, with the exceptions of a few appetizers to pick from. Not a lot. See for yourself. Its a convenient location in the Hyde Park (HP) area. But with so many other options in HP, this may be a purposeful selection. Because as stated above, yu would need to be in the mood for either a burger or pizza. Or if not, both. :p
Great beer selection
Overpriced drinks, but fun atmosphere.

I’ve been a Jolly Pumpkin beer fan for years, so I was pumped when they came to the neighborhood. If you don’t know their beers, they’re funky, they’re sour, their creative. But don’t worry... if that’s not your thing, they have North Peak beers with your pale ales, IPAs, stouts, etc.  I love having these world class beers in Hyde Park. Prices are good ($6-$8) and the staff is friendly. The food is upscale pub food. Some find it a little pricey. I agree. It’s on the expensive side, but the pizzas and sandwiches I’ve had a good. I’m more likely to come for the drinks than the food. The biggest downside is the service situation - you gotta order at the register (unless you’re sitting at the bar). Inconvenient at times? Sure. But the line usually moves quick and it’s only a mild inconvenience. And I’ll stand in line any day to have access 10-12 Jolly Pumpkin beers (seasonal and rotating taps all year long) on tap any day. And you can buy bottles to go 👍🏼  EDIT: Went 2/2/19 and they now have table service. A welcomed change. And they have a whole new food menu.
I never expect much from this place, and it's always better than it seems like it should be.  The mushroom pizza is very good.
Knowledgeable and friendly bartender. Good chats about beer. Happy to provide samples. Menu was recently updated but was happy to talk about new menu items.
Now that they fixed their service, this place is top-notch. Highly recommend.
The beers are super and innovative, but man the service is somewhere between i dont care and unfriendly! I'd love to try the food but im afraid of being scolded if i dont like it.  Yikes.
Great food great beer great service

Uninspired and not very friendly. The bartender grabbed the beer list out of my hand and started crossing things off.. didn’t take the time to make any recommendations at all. The food was fine; it’s a bit overpriced but good enough that I wouldn’t need to leave to get food.  Altogether, the service experience was poor and the food decent. With so many good breweries in Chicago that are happy to get my business, I won’t be coming back to JP. Shame as I’ve been going to the Michigan locations for years and this was not at all consistent with the good times I’ve had there.
Great food and great drinks.  Staff is wonderful
The Whitefish and Crab Burger, with truffle fries,   was amazing!!!
Nice place good atmosphere
Nice variety menu, just stop by after finishing some work for a client I just had some fries and a soft drink but a very nice atmosphere great ambience

Such a welcome addition to Hyde Park. Great pizza, delicious Brussel sprout and Farro salad and don't forget the beer. JP makes a dozen different sour beers but if that's not your thing (it should be), they have about 10 more "normal" beers from their sister Brewery, North Peak. Lotsa flat screen tvs for watching sports. Also, JP bottles their own spirits so they have a full cocktail list.
Not too many vegan options, and the fries were less than great. Service is pleasant enough and it's a nice vibe.
Great hip place a little pricey
Awesome!!!!!
Great place... Can't wait til they transformer it
Excellent beer and food.
Good food.
Food was great service was excellent a bit pricey though but all in all a good experience

Had a JB Burger with Truffle fries and a short rib pizza. The burger was on point cooked really well and the bacon was very good. A little too heavy on the mushrooms but it didnt bother me. Their pizzas are nice artisan style, came out looking very amazing mad i didnt take photos! Ill be back lol
This is my second time going. Great service and beer. Definitely a must go to spot in hyde park
Food is just okay
Best nachos in da world, no lie
Great Food. Something for everyone. The bar and it's expansion of beer is great ad well.

username: Carlos Andrés Rascón Díaz de Léon

caption: A silly name to a seriously tasty pub! The pizza was hot and fresh and the beers were unique and tasty. Would easily go back for more!
Just had drinks.   Cool place..
Great food and size is large enough that you can hang out for a long time. The model is that you don’t have a wait staff waiting on you so there’s no pressure to move along.
Great place to drink and chill.
Nice spot....
Good beer, pizza and Korean BBQ wings. They had music Bingo the Wednesday that I went. Won a $20 Jolly Pumpkin gift card. Hello.
Not personable

Jolly Pumpkin was delightful. The food was WAY over expectation (not that we were expecting the worst) and their beer was pretty good. Working in Hyde Park some years ago, I didn't know what to expect of any of the new places that has help gentrify my baby 😂. This Michigan implant is more that welcome to keep pumping out food and beer though.
Got a NEW place to drink and eat.
A little bit pricey, but everything was tasty and the drinks were wonderful.

Good menu, odd set up. You get up and order everything at counter, pick up your own silverware, played, hail your own drinks. So, with a big group, not great. And not good if you're looking to be served. You'll do your own work to get stuff here. But the food and drinks are delicious. I had their cocktails: supurb. Everything we ate: fantastic. Go and enjoy, but know what to expect.
Nice place good customer service...

Food was cold, expensive and lackluster. The person who brought our food gave us the wrong pizza, we didn’t realize right away and started to eat off of it. The server took the pizza away and was going to serve it to another customer instead of having the kitchen remake it. Disgusting.
Fun place to enjoy the game, the food and the service.
Cool place and the  large food choices are awesome. Good beers....Children welcome. Spacious. Picnic table style. My Favorite!

Food is okay but is not a good value to me. I don't mind paying when food is very good or unique in some way, not so here for me. It not horrible but would  not be my 1st choice. Their speciality is wide selection of beers. I'm not a beer drinker so I can't speak to this. I do like that this is a unique quality for the restaurant.  Try it for yourself to see how you like it ,but I don't have to return.
Delicious food with a nice atmosphere.  I loved the Korean wings and the truffled pizza!
Sitting on the patio having a beer and the male server approached everyone but me. Never will come back to this place. Also it's very touristy, no real feel of a good Chicago pub/restaurant.
I enjoyed the food, drinks, and the comfortable atmosphere to watch college football on a Saturday afternoon with friends.
A great experience, their burgers are great,I couldn't finish it because it was really large warmed it up the next day and wow so moist and juicy,looking forward to my next visit.
Fun, great mushroom pizza
Adequate brews & food, atmosphere is festive. Hyde Park desperately needs more watering holes like Jolly.
Atmosphere was nice
Good Beers great food
Pizza was good only compliant is was not lot of table free
Delicious, the nachos are a must!

The space is really nice, but this wasn't a very good experience.  We only ordered fries to munch on with our beers, and they took about a half hour to get to us.  A half an hour!  And they weren't even busy!  There's also something weird going on with the beers.  One of my favorite Jolly Pumpkin beers is "Madrugada Obscura" which is a sour stout that tastes kind of like a chocolate covered cherry.  I've had it on several occasions on draft and out of the bottle, and it's always been delicious.  I had one here and it was awful!  What is going on!
The wings, pizza (South Pacific) and beer were excellent!! Very friendly staff, too!
Great beer and food. Cool, casual atmosphere.

Was hoping for some unique selection, but it was the standard JP offering when I was there. Nothing I couldn't get in a bottle shop. Good CA style pizzas. Was not disappointing , but was hoping for more.

There was a great selection of beer (I really like the biere de Mars) and the pizza was tasty. We tried their Greek pizza, with kalamata olives and feta cheese, and it hit the spot. I would definitely try it again. Good spot for the end of a bike ride down to Hyde Park
Short rib sandwich or pizza, u can't go wrong....
Nice atmosphere and good beer.
We tried the Chicken Nachos & the Korean Wing appetizers. Great choices. Great customer service. Nice atmosphere.
Great customer service the pizza awesome....
Food is decent, service is great and good beer.
Interesting place where you order at a counter rather than at your table

Decent selection of beers. No customer service (you place the order yourself). The food is okay (nothing special--especially for Chicago). However, the location is great & there are plenty of spots to visit when you're done with your meal. For instance, the Hyde Park Cigar Shop is across the street
Visited this location while in Chicago on business. Great food, great unique beers, and a great environment. Highly recommend stopping here at the Jolly Pumpkin.

Food was delicious; the beer was phenomenal. Can't believe it wasn't busier, but that means the service was also top notch so I can't complain. They make their own spirits and their cocktails are unique and tasty.
Service was great, as an chicken wings are fye however the pizza was horrible!!!!!
Great addition to Hyde park
They have a rotating selection of beers with a number of sours. Had to pretty good food too. I plan to keep coming back. Absolutely worth a try if you like beer.
the food was good. I had black bean burger. IT was Juicy! Good stuff!
Staff were incredibly friendly. Parking is a nightmare. Food is B+. Pizza felt stale by the time I got it home (take out).
Decent fries, great beer. Chicken sandwich was good, but I asked for my burger to be medium rare and it came out well done.
Solid atmosphere, very good pizza, and an interesting selection of drinks. They seem to specialize in sour drinks, which led to a night of unique beers and cocktails I hadn't tried anywhere else.
Decent food, too expensive
Good beer selection and nice service.
Great beer,  food and people
A great place to grab a beer before a movie @ the Harper theater. Very friendly staff
Great food, reasonable prices, crowded during the evenings. The beer is mostly sour; I know that that is their shtick, but all the flavours sort of blend together.
Great beer, great pizza, great place
food is yummy and the decor is stylish. they have cafeteria tables basically, where everyone sits close to one another. the seating bothers me but it's not really a big deal.

I love the pizza, I like the beer (from outside breweries, not the house sours), but the service is TERRIBLE. Greater than 2/3rd of the staff are rude or at best unfriendly. Makes me feel gross about patronizing this place, but we have so few options in Hyde Park.
